articles.author: SETH BORENSTEIN, MARY KATHERINE WILDEMAN and BOBBY CAINA CALVAN
articles.description: KIHEI, Hawaii (AP) — Hurricane-fueled flash floods and mudslides. Lava that creeps into neighborhoods. Fierce drought that materializes in a flash and lingers. Earthquakes. And now, deadly fires that burn block after historic block.
articles.title: Fires and others disasters are increasing in Hawaii, according to this AP data analysis

articles.author: JOSH BOAK and EMILY SWANSON
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden has devoted the past several weeks to promoting the positive impacts of his policies — but his efforts have yet to meaningfully register with the public.Only 36% of U.S.
articles.title: Biden's approval rating on the economy stagnates despite slowing inflation, AP-NORC poll shows

articles.author: ANNE M. PETERSON
articles.description: U.S. women's national team coach Vlatko Andonovski has resigned, a person familiar with the decision told The Associated Press on Wednesday.The move comes less than two weeks after the Americans were knocked out of the Women's World Cup earlier than ever before.
articles.title: US women’s national team coach Vlatko Andonovski resigns after early World Cup exit, AP source says

articles.author: HANNAH SCHOENBAUM
articles.description: RALEIGH, N.C. (AP) — Transgender youth in North Carolina lost access Wednesday to gender-affirming medical treatments after the Republican-led General Assembly overrode the governor’s vetoes of that legislation and other bills touching on gender in sports and LGBTQ+ instruction in the classroom.
articles.title: Veto overridden: Ban on gender-affirming care for minors takes effect in North Carolina

articles.author: KATE BRUMBACK
articles.description: ATLANTA (AP) — The prosecutor in Atlanta who obtained an indictment this week against former President Donald Trump and 18 others wants to take the case to trial in March.
articles.title: Georgia prosecutor seeks March trial date for Trump and 18 others in election case

articles.author: DARLENE SUPERVILLE
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Camp David, the rustic presidential retreat in the mountains of Maryland, has been a backdrop for signal moments in U.S. foreign policy, perhaps none more notable than the peace accord President Jimmy Carter brokered between Egypt and Israel in 1978.
articles.title: Biden will use Camp David backdrop hoping to broker a breakthrough in Japan-South Korea relations

articles.author: JESSE BEDAYN
articles.description: DENVER (AP) — Destinee Thompson was supposed to be on her way to lunch with her stepmother in August 2021 when Colorado police, mistaking her for a robbery suspect, fatally shot the pregnant mother as she fled in her minivan.
articles.title: Police who fatally shot a pregnant woman are sued by her family in Colorado

articles.author: KEVIN McGILL
articles.description: NEW ORLEANS (AP) — Mail-order access to a drug used in the most common form of abortion in the U.S. would end under a federal appeals court ruling issued Wednesday that cannot take effect until the Supreme Court weighs in.
articles.title: An appeals court backs some abortion drug limits, pending the Supreme Court's approval

articles.description: YELLOWKNIFE, Northwest Territories (AP) — Residents in the capital of Canada's Northwest Territories were ordered to evacuate Wednesday night as wildfires neared the city of 20,000 people.People in the four areas of Yellowknife at highest risk should leave as soon as possible and residents in other areas have until noon Friday to leave, the Northwest Territories government said.
articles.title: Residents ordered to evacuate the capital of Canada’s Northwest Territories as wildfires near

articles.description: MEXICO CITY (AP) — Nicaragua’s government has confiscated a prestigious Jesuit-run university alleging it was a “center of terrorism,” the college said Wednesday in announcing the latest in a series of actions by authorities against the Catholic Church and opposition figures.
articles.title: Nicaraguan government seizes highly regarded university from Jesuits
